description:
FORMA is a family of brands leading what’s next in beauty. FORMA leverages global product development, regulatory, and supply chain capabilities, and a prolific influencer network to celebrate, support, and seek out those changing the world through highly differentiated beauty brands. We’re committed to creating a more beautiful tomorrow—we are FORMA.


Summary of Position:

The Corporate Accountant role will report to the Director of Finance and Accounting and will help drive month end close and implement process change within the accounting team. Primary responsibilities will include all inventory related accounts, accrued dilution, and all revenue / COGS transactions. Other responsibilities involve process and system improvements, management reporting and analysis, and supporting other functions within the accounting team as well as the broader organization.


Principle Accountabilities:

Lead in month-end closes by analyzing activity for assigned accounts (Inventory on hand, internal in transit, external in transit, inventory provision, capitalized freight, capitalized duties, intercompany, accrued chargebacks/returns/dilution) preparing journal entries, and reconciling general ledger accounts for assigned balance sheet and income statement accounts (65%)


Perform Revenue and COGS analysis to ensure sales and fulfillments have been properly reflected in the general ledger and prepare daily summaries for the CFO and executive management team – 10%


Collaborate with FP&A to perform financial statement analysis/margin analysis and document meaningful explanations for fluctuations to help management make business decisions – 10%


Other ad hoc projects include but are not limited to (15%):


Develop and implement process improvements, document desktop procedures and processes to achieve efficiencies


Support external audit requirements


Develop/implement improvements to standard COGS / PPV to include freight/duty in COGS and eliminate need for separate capitalized freight/duty accounts.


Standard COGS and streamlined transfer pricing elimination process build out


Assist management in completing special projects and analyses on an ad-hoc basis


Key Working Relationships:

Accounting and FP&A team members


Business leaders, including wholesale sales and DTC


Required Skills & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Economics or Finance required


1- 2 years of related professional experience


Consumer products or manufacturing industry experience is preferred, but not required


Netsuite experience preferred, but not required


Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills


Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


Team player and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
